channel.title: [P.I] Hiscores
channel.description:
So i got the hiscores handler successfully connected to the sql database. Then when i go to logout and it sends the packets to save the files to the database it comes up with this error:
http://pastebin.com/GR8EGj67
It may be because of the permissions.. at the moment when i click on let's say "strength" on the hiscores it says "You don't have permission to access /Highscores-/ on this server.
That may be the issue? I'm not sure.
Any help is appreciated.

item.title: [P.I] Hiscores
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

I’d rather not. Adding your skype takes away from the possibility of publicly solving the issue, which means if another user gets your same problem (and it’s bound to happen) there will be nothing to reference them to.

Read full topic

item.title: [P.I] Hiscores
item.dc:creator: @nathanz nathanz
item.description:
@nathanz wrote:

Add my skype please: mrzeus6

Read full topic

item.title: [P.I] Hiscores
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

It literally tells you what’s wrong:

You have an error in your SQL syntax; check the manual that corresponds to your MySQL server version for the right syntax to use near '= 'nathan'' at line 1

What does your database look like?

Read full topic

item.title: [P.I] Hiscores
item.dc:creator: @nathanz nathanz
item.description:
@nathanz wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:4, topic:538686”][quote author=nathanz link=topic=657516.msg4398825#msg4398825 date=1389983568]

Your website isn’t allowing the server to connect to it for whatever reason. Make sure it can access the site via Remote MySQL.

It does have access, it successfully connnects on startup. It’s when it tried to save to the hiscores alot of errors appear.
[/quote]
The errors you showed or different ones? if different show them.[/quote]

http://pastebin.com/SFNAFMRT

Read full topic
